content.raw:
You can use the [tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=drcsim_robotiq_hand&cat=drcsim) if you launch Atlas. I don't recommend you to apply forces to the joints while we have our drcsim plugin running because the fingers are already controlled by the robotiq plugin.

The other alternative is to start gazebo with `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH` pointing to  <YOUR_CATKIN_DIR>`install/share/drcsim_gazebo_standalone_models/`. Then, spawn the robotiq hand, and then apply forces manually to the joints. If you want to see the coupling working you can play with `finger_middle_joint_proximal_actuating_hinge`.
content.html:
You can use the tutorial if you launch Atlas. I don't recommend you to apply forces to the joints while we have our drcsim plugin running because the fingers are already controlled by the robotiq plugin.

The other alternative is to start gazebo with GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH pointing to <YOUR_CATKIN_DIR>install/share/drcsim_gazebo_standalone_models/. Then, spawn the robotiq hand, and then apply forces manually to the joints. If you want to see the coupling working you can play with finger_middle_joint_proximal_actuating_hinge.
